english: to dote on; to favor; to pamper; favored

etymology.interpretation: A roof element 宀 conveys a household or shelter context, while 龍 provides the sound and an association with high status or special favor. Together they convey the idea of someone specially favored or indulged within the household, hence “to dote on” or “to pamper.”
etymology.simplification: Replaced the phonetic 龍 with its simplified form 龙 and dropped the 心 component, yielding 宀 + 龙 while preserving the phonetic value.

examples.chinese: 她太宠孩子了(她太寵孩子了)。
examples.english: She spoils the child too much.

examples.chinese: 他在宫里很得宠(他在宮裡很得寵)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zài gōng lǐ hěn dé chǒng.
examples.english: He is much favored in the palace.

examples.chinese: 这只狗是他最宠爱的伙伴(這隻狗是他最寵愛的夥伴)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè zhī gǒu shì tā zuì chǒng’ài de huǒbàn.
examples.english: This dog is his most beloved companion.
